text.0: loud neighs the tawny steed when started settling deep in the wooden vessel while they cleanse him.
text.1: led by the men he takes the milk for raiment then shall he through his powers engender praisesongs.
text.2: as one who rows drives on his boat he goldhued sends forth his voice loosed on the path of order.
text.3: as god the secret names of gods he utters to be declared on sacred grass more widely.
text.4: hastening onward like the waves of waters our holy hymns are pressing nigh to soma.
text.5: to him they come with lowly adoration and longing enter him who longs to meet them.
text.6: they drain the stalk the steer who dwells on mountains even as a bull who decks him on the upland.
text.7: hymns follow and attend him as he bellows trita bears varuṇa aloft in ocean.
text.8: sending thy voice out as director loosen the invokers thought o indu as they cleanse thee.
text.9: while thou and indra rule for our advantage may we be masters of heroic vigour.
